message.content:
cs.DC, cs.GT, cs.NI, cs.MA, cs.SY. 

The paper proposes a game theoretic framework for task allocation in mobile cloud computing, which involves offloading compute tasks to nearby mobile devices. This involves optimizing the allocation of tasks based on computational capabilities and cost of computation at these nodes, with the goal of reducing overall job completion time. The paper also deals with node mobility and proposes a heuristic approach to dynamically find the best time intervals between auctions to minimize unnecessary auctions and overheads. Based on this, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories are cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) and cs.GT (Computer Science and Game Theory), as the paper deals with task allocation and optimization using game theoretic approaches. The other likely sub-categories are cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture), cs.MA (Multiagent Systems), and cs.SY (Systems and Control), as the paper deals with mobile cloud computing and node mobility.
